DOC.brief_summary: The Long-Term Outcomes Study ( LTOS ) multi-center longitudinal cohort study patient receive X-STOP device Pivotal Trial , Continued Access Protocol ( CAP ) , Cross-over Study ( COS ) . It design supplement postmarket safety effectiveness data gather Condition Approval ( CoA ) study population patient moderately impaired physical function elect undergo X-STOP surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Long-Term Outcomes Lumbar Spinal Stenosis Patients Treated With X STOPÂ®
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluate long term safety effectiveness X-Stop interspinous process decompression system In patient receive X-Stop IDE . These patient consist two cohort evaluate : patient moderately impaired physical function prior X-Stop implantation ( determined baseline score > 2.0 physical function ( PF ) domain Zurich claudication questionnaire ) , patient mildly impaired physical function prior X-Stop surgery ( determine baseline score < =2.0 PF domain Zurich claudication questionnaire ( ZCQ ) , fifth postoperative year . Clinical examination perform office visit confirm absence neurological complication . X-ray film ( AP/lateral view ) take fifth postoperative year , analyze confirm A ) maintenance distraction B ) absence radiological evidence device-related complication . Secondary endpoint include mean score SF-36 , incidence rate adverse event , device failure , secondary surgery .
DOC.criteria: A patient admit LTOS program he/she meet follow inclusion criterion : 1 . Completed participation Pivotal Trial , CAP , COS X STOP implant ( ) intact time LTOS enrollment ; OR active CAP/COS participant , X STOP implant ( ) intact , complete 24month followup visit his/her CAP/COS study . 2 . Is willing able provide Informed Consent 3 . Is willing able return clinic clinical evaluation complete study questionnaire without clinic visit . A patient admit LTOS program he/she meet follow exclusion criterion : 1 . Participated Pivotal Trial part X STOP group , device remove . 2 . Participated CAP COS program , device remove .
